comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Ilona von Rosty, represented the Hungarian Red Cross in a delegation visiting POW camps in Russia in 1915; mentioned in Nancy Meriwether Wingfield and Maria Bucur, Gender and war in twentieth-century Eastern Europe(Indiana University Press 2006): 31-32. books.google.com/books?id=wOfAZrkRM7wC

comment.author: 48889055628@N01
comment._content: There's also a pic of Archduchess Auguste of Bavaria [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/6779750760/] with a red cross insignia on her arm and belt buckle. I think she had some Hungarian connections, too. A newspaper article from 1914 says she was a nurse in Budapest.
